domain.name: Political Body
domain.description: A section of a government, like The Supreme Court

entity.name: How Chinese residents on lockdown manage the day-to-day amid the coronavirus outbreak
entity.description: The Chinese city of Wuhan, which is considered to be ground zero for the coronavirus outbreak, is in its 10th day of the government-imposed lockdown. From wearing PJs in public to avoiding hospitals, journalist @amyyqin shared how the city has transformed amid the epidemic.

entity.name: China finishes construction of makeshift hospital for coronavirus patients, state media reports
entity.description: Construction of one of the makeshift hospitals for coronavirus patients began on January 23 in Wuhan, where the outbreak first began. The 1,000-bed Huoshenshan Hospital will start taking patients from Monday.

text: @DHSCgovuk What provisions have you made for a mass outbreak of viral pneumonia? In Wuhan, they’ve built a hospital for coronovirus patients in one week. Also, given how short staffed and struggling the NHS is, how is it going to cope with this extra emergency on top of winter emergencies?
